item.title: The is a pot hole round the drain by the pond, 26th February
item.description:
This pot hole has been getting bigger and is difficult to avoid when cars come round the corner and you are on the same side as it. It is now deep enough that if you drive over at the wrong angle it can cause damage. If this gets any bigger it will cause the drain to collapse
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Main Road, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The speed hump at the bottom of The Landway has an ever increasing pothole, 26th February
item.description:
The pot hole that is at the approach from the shop end on Main Road on the speed table at the bottom of The Landway is incredible dangerous as it is so deep that you cannot travel over it from either side safely going up onto the table or coming down is causing damage to vehicles
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Main Road, St Paul's Cray, Greater London

item.title: Steet gutters and pathways need cleaning, 26th February

item.title: Night and day clanking of manhole cover, 26th February
item.description:
This issue was previously reported, and I received an email confirming that it had been resolved. However, this is not the case, as the problem still persists. Could you please clarify why it was marked as fixed and provide an update on when the issue will be properly resolved? I also telephoned the number provided and spoke to a customer service representative who advised me he would send details over to me regarding this query but that has not happened. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tooley Street, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti sprayed on electric vehicle charging stations along Stockwell Road SW9, 26th February
item.description:
I like to report graffiti sprayed on two electric vehicle charging stations along Stockwell main road SW9. The stations are situated as you approach Stockwell underground station. The graffiti has been there for approximately two weeks. Please could you remove them it be very much appreciated.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Burnley Road, Stockwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 133 Kiln Place London NW5 4AP, 26th February
item.description:
This is comming from the rear of the tenants hall and from property 133 Kiln Place. A waste pipe that is comming from the property has been directed to a public footway causing dirt, grime and fungus and a slippery surface, this is an imminent danger as adults and children alike use this which my children have to pass through everyday too. I would like that waste pipe to be redirected to a proper waste service and not the footway we all use.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grafton Road, Gospel Oak, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 46 Dunstan Road up until 73 dunstan road, 26th February
item.description:
The entire road is full of large and deep potholes, right down the middle. Drivers on both sides are having to swerve them. Very dangerous. Not only for our cars but for near accidents due to how severely people are swerving to avoid the potholes
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dunstan Road, Golders Green, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
